Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Knowingly \Know"ing*ly\, adv. 1. With knowledge; in a knowing manner; intelligently; consciously; deliberately; as, he would not knowingly offend. --Strype. [1913 Webster]
2. By experience. [Obs.] --Shak. [1913 Webster]
knowingly adv : with full knowledge and deliberation; "he wittingly deleted the references" [syn: {wittingly}] [ant: {unwittingly}, {unwittingly}]
